result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin M Hoard

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kevin M Hoard in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Kevin M Hoard.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for plea and sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Defendant sworn. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 2 AND 3 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Parties request a separate date for sentencing.  Court ordered defendant REINSTATED to Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION.  All previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect. 
 Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Kevin M Hoard in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel requests a Plea/Sentencing date. Case adjourned to Br 02.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kevin M Hoard in court with Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask; both appear in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Information has been rejected as it contains Count 3 which has been previously dismissed. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin M Hoard in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Domask has been appointed. Case was mistabbed to Branch 45. Case is adjourned to preliminary court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin M Hoard in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel. SPD has not appointed counsel at this time. State requests an Order to Show cause hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to Br. 45.  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 5-20-2022
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kevin M Hoard in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Kevin M Hoard in custody.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kevin M Hoard appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.  AS TO COUNT 3:  Motion to dismiss by the defense, argued and GRANTED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
